author: Anders Lund
message:
Nice development, but there is a behavior change that is not mentioned: sorting and filtering now works on the exif date instead of the file date, which may be nice in some situations, but very bad in other.

I prefer file date for that mostly, but what about having both? This version of gwenview have low usability for me for that reason :(

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message:
It was always supposed to be sorted by exif date but a change in kdelibs broke it. In 2.9 I changed the implementation to avoid this bug.
Having said this, I understand sorting by exif date is slower. having both could be nice. Should be easy to implement if you are interested (hint! hint!)

replies.author: Anders Lund
replies.message: The problem is not speed (although the current date sorting is indeed very slow), but function. I get batches of images from others, so being able to look at them by file date is much smarter when I want to view a new batch.

author: Tractorman2011
message:
Thank you for Gwenview.   I first used a distro that had something else as the default and it was so awful  I went online to find something better.   I found Gwenview and now have been using it for years. 

A small thought: I had been looking for the slideshow interval and finally found it in your instruction manual.  Having the setting inside the full-screen configuration does not seem obvious to me, though there may be a reason it fits there.  My first thought was always to look in Settings - Configure Gwenview.   Now that I have found it, there is no problem for me, but others may be looking for it and not finding it.

Again, my thanks for your work.  You must really love the project, as you have given us so much. 

Have a great holiday season.

Ed

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Hi,

The slideshow delay is in the fullscreen configuration because I expected user would want to adjust it while the slideshow is running, so it would be faster to go there than having to:
1. leave the slideshow
2. open the settings dialog and change the value
3. close the dialog
4. restart the slideshow
5. Go back to 1. if the new delay was actually too fast/slow.

author: Tractorman2011
message:
That explanation makes sense, though I still wish it were easier to find the first time. If the user does know where to look, the setting does not seem available. 

A second thought--if I am previewing a batch of pictures in the smaller size, clicking the slideshow button (I added it to my toolbar) changes the image to fullscreen and changes the menus.  I would prefer it stayed the smaller size (I have some vision issues and have to move away from the monitor for the fullscreen size to be comfortable), but I understand that may add unwarranted complexity.

Thank you for your work.  This is a great program and trivial issues like the ones I have mentioned certainly do not detract from it.
